scenarioDescription:
The GJ 393 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 393 is a star with 0.43 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.43 times its radius. It is located 22.93 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 393 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 393 system


GJ 393 b

GJ 393 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2021-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 393 b is 1.711 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 393 b is 1.170 that of Earth. At 1.711 Earth masses, GJ 393 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system GJ 393, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: GJ 393 - System With 1 Exoplanet
